translations: 抢劫，盗取；（非正式）敲诈，漫天要价；剥夺，使丧失；夺（对手的）球（rob 的现在分词）

sentences.sentence: Two security guards tackled and apprehended a man suspected of robbing 17 banks.
sentences.translation: 两名保安与一名涉嫌抢劫17家银行的男子搏斗并逮捕了他。

sentences.sentence: The police released the first video images yesterday of the two men believed to have been involved in robbing a jewelry shop in the city seven days ago.
sentences.translation: 警方昨天公布了第一组录像画面，画面显示两名男子涉嫌7天前在该市抢劫一家珠宝店。

sentences.sentence: Even well-meaning parents may be "robbing them of the opportunity to have that joy of discovery and curiosity the opportunity to find things out on their own."
sentences.translation: 即使父母是出于好意，也可能会“剥夺他们通过发现与好奇心获得乐趣的机会，也就是自行探索事物的机会。”
